meanings.definition: Teazled (verb): to comb or card wool or cloth with a teasel.
meanings.sent1: She carefully teazled the wool to make it softer.
meanings.sent2: The tailor teazled the fabric before sewing it into a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent3: The sheep felt teazled after the thorough combing session.
meanings.sent4: Her gentle hands teazled the fabric, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The act of teazling the wool brought out its natural beauty and texture.

meanings.definition: Teazled (adjective): having been combed or carded with a teasel.
meanings.sent1: The teazled fabric felt incredibly soft against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The teazled wool had a unique texture that made it stand out.
meanings.sent3: The teazled blanket looked so fluffy that it seemed to be floating.
meanings.sent4: The teazled material shimmered in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The teazled cloth was so smooth that it almost felt like silk.
